repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Payment System and Banking System
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory,. The lessons learned indicate that overall
            strong support and ownership from the Borrower during
            project preparation and implementation contributed to the
            successful completion of the project. A strong,
            knowledgeable and well-staffed Project Management Unit (PMU)
            was required to deal with the complex procurement processes
            and to meet the demands from participating commercial banks
            and the World Bank. Legal and regulatory changes have to go
            hand-in-hand with the introduction of a new banking system
            so that they can provide timely and consistent legal support
            and build a legal environment basis for the new banking
            system to operate effectively. Close supervision by the
            Bank's task manager ensured that the project's
            implementation schedule was on track. Clear operational
            guidelines within the Bank are needed to avoid adverse
            effects on the supervision and implementation of the project
            in the client country, particularly when the Bank has to
            resolve disputes arising from the implementation of its
            guidelines. Capacity building and institutional development
            activities that effectively address critical needs of an
            economy in transition in general and of the banking sector
            in particular can be sustained with ease beyond the life of
            the project. Clearer procurement procedures and guidelines
            help to better address complaints in the procurement
            process. The need to focus on manpower training will be
            critical for the successful implementation of these
            projects. Technical systems such as the IBPS and intrabank
            payment system require a back-up system. Physical security
            and integrity of the IBPS and CBPS systems need to be
            considered as the highest priority to protect the systems.
            Clear definitions and guidelines regarding verification and
            acceptance of deliverables as well as billing and payment
            procedures should be established up front to avoid long
            payment delays to suppliers and consultants.

18157709.trustfund:
TF030399-NEW ZEALAND CTF FY03 - EAST
            ASIA AND PACIFIC,TF025194-PHRD-BANKING MODERNIZATION,TF030327-IRISH CTF FY03 - EAST ASIA
            & PACIFIC,TF020334-PAYMENT SYSTEM & BANK
            MODERNIZATION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Viet Nam - Payment System and Bank
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ultimate objective of the Bank
            System Modernization Project is to assist in the development
            of a modern banking sector able to service the needs of a
            growing economy, thereby increasing confidence in the
            Vietnamese banking system. The immediate objectives of the
            project are to: 1) improve payment services in the economy
            in order to reduce float, speed up circulation of funds and
            increase efficiency of funds transmission, while providing
            convenience and service to users; and 2) strengthen the
            institutional capabilities of participating banks in order
            to stimulate commercial bank initiatives to improve internal
            management and customer service. The project consists of
            four components: 1) a national inter-bank payment clearing
            and settlement system; 2) commercial banks' intra-bank
            payment systems; 3) commercial banks' institutional
            strengthening; and 4) project management support.

Viet Nam - Payment System and Bank
